item.title: Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake details new content ‘Seabed’
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Square Enix and developer Artdink Corporation have released new information for Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake introducing game’s new content, the Seabed.

Get the details below.

■ The Ocean Depths Offer a New Stage for Adventure! Explore Every Corner of This Uncharted Ocean World!

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake has received various enhancements, and it has been revealed that you can now explore the ocean depths in Dragon Quest II! A wider world awaits, full of new encounters!

—As you progress through the story of Dragon Quest II, you will be able to travel by ship not only on the ocean’s surface but also underwater!

—The merfolk live quietly under the ocean’s surface. In addition to Mersea, the town where they live, dangerous dungeons can also be found.

■ Save the Mermaids From Monsters Threatening Peace in the Ocean!

During their adventure, the main character and his comrades encounter two mermaids and learn that the ocean depths are under attack by Hargon’s minions. Protect the mermaids from the evil forces lurking beneath the ocean’s surface and restore peace to the sea!

—The protagonists encounter a pair of mermaids after a certain incident. Their encounter with the mermaids brings various developments to the story.

—It seems that the town where the mermaids live and the Mermaids’ Sanctuary are also under threat from monsters.

—There are sunken ships and places that look like hideouts in the depths of the ocean. Explore every corner of the vast submerged world.

Defeat a New Powerful Enemy You Encounter Under the Sea!

Mariella, one of Hargon’s Champions, emerges as a formidable enemy threatening the peace of the seas! She stands before the protagonists, aiming to conquer the underwater world!

Explore the Further Uncharted Seabed

As the story progresses, you’ll be able to dive even deeper to the Seabed! What could possibly be waiting there…?!

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on October 30. Digital pre-orders are available now for all platforms.

View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Nintendo of America president and COO Doug Bowser to retire
item.content:encoded:
• Nintendo

Bowser to be succeeded by 19-year industry veteran Devon Pritchard.

Nintendo of America president and chief operating officer Doug Bowser will retire on December 31, 2025, after more than a decade in multiple leadership roles, the company announced.

Bowser will be succeeded by Devon Pritchard, a 19-year veteran of the video game industry and long-standing member of the Nintendo of America leadership team. Pritchard will also join the Nintendo of America board of directors and become a Nintendo Co. executive officer.

Nintendo Co. managing executive officer, corporate director, and board member Satoru Shibata will also join Nintendo of America as chief executive officer, while continuing his existing roles.

“One of my earliest video game experiences was playing the arcade version of Donkey Kong,” said Bowser in a press release. “Since that time, all things Nintendo have continued to be a passion for both me and my family. Leading Nintendo of America has been the honor of a lifetime, and I am proud of what our team has accomplished in both business results and the experiences we’ve created for consumers.”

Bowser continued, “Now, it’s time for the next generation of leadership and Devon’s track record speaks for itself. She is an exceptional leader, and her promotion is a testament to her strong performance and strategic contributions to the company’s growth. I have full confidence that she will guide the company to even greater heights.”

Pritchard added, “I am humbled and excited to take on this new role. Doug has been a fantastic mentor, and I look forward to building on the incredible foundation he has helped establish. With characters and worlds that offer something for everyone, my focus will be continuing to build on Nintendo’s legacy of surprising and delighting our longtime fans, while at the same time welcoming new players into the Nintendo family.”

Furukawa said, “During his tenure, Doug made numerous contributions to bring smiles to the faces of people connected to Nintendo. I would like to express my gratitude for his strong efforts. Devon, who will become the next president, has also made many contributions to Nintendo over the years. I am confident that, like Doug, Devon will continue to support Nintendo’s important mission of creating smiles.”

(Image via @TheTrueBowser.)
